meanings.definition: Having an outline or surface curved like the exterior of a circle or sphere.
meanings.sent1: The convex mirror reflected the light in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The convex lens helped magnify the image.
meanings.sent3: The convex shape of the balloon made it bounce unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a convex rainbow, spreading joy everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The convex curve of the road ahead made it hard to see what was coming.

meanings.definition: Curving outward like the exterior of a circle or sphere.
meanings.sent1: The convex glass distorted the view of the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The convex surface of the bubble made it look larger than it was.
meanings.sent3: The convex mirror made her reflection appear comically stretched.
meanings.sent4: His ego was as convex as a hot air balloon, always expanding.
meanings.sent5: The convex shape of the hill made it challenging to climb.
